intro: Sideroxylon manglillo, commonly known as the manglillo tree, is a member of the family Olacaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in humid, lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. The tree is valued for its hard, durable wood and is often used in local construction and crafts.
